alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 28 at 7:24PM MST until March 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches possible with locally higher amounts up to 10 inches above 9,000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph producing blowing snow reducing visibility. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Far Northwest Highlands, Northwest Highlands, West Central Plateau, and West Central Mountains. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
